titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Walter M. Benner (b. 1888) was a botanist at the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia. He received his master's degree and Ph.D. from the University of Pennsylvania and began as a research associate at the Academy in 1928. He was appointed acting chairman of the Botany Department in 1958. He conducted many field trips in Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Maryland, and Delaware, and in 1932 he published The Flora of Bucks County, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the field notebooks and collection records of Walter Benner. The volumes include a collection record which lists specimen number, name, date, and location; lists of plants collected or recorded from trips to Pennsylvania, New Jersey, and elsewhere, between 1913 and 1951; a notebook with descriptions of plants, possibly transcribed from a number of botanical reference works; a botany journal possibly transcribed from journals kept by the Ruth brothers (John A. and Harvey F. Ruth, d. 1904?) between 1882 and 1914; and an annotated copy of The Flora of Bucks County, Pennsylvania, 1932.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
